pullRequest.body:
Free monoids over isomorphic types are isomorphic. Also, converting a relation on free monoid α to free monoids over β, when α and β are isomorphic

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

nodes.body:
### PR summary [1abf08452e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18563/commits/1abf08452e74e24499f62777cca45c9adb847255)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ comapRel`
`+ congrEquiv`
`+ congrEquiv_of`
`+ congrEquiv_symm_of`
`+ mapRel`
`+ map_apply_map_symm_eq`
`+ map_symm_apply_map_eq`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
</details>

> One rule of thumb when adding definitions to mathlib is that they should be accompanied by lemmas that provide the basic API.
> 
> Typically, such lemmas could be tagged with `@[simp]` if they are simplifying a left-hand side to a right-hand side.
> 
> In this case, it would be good to have lemmas about how your definitions interact with generators of the free monoid, etc...

Makes total sense! I've added in congrEquiv_one, congrEquiv_of, and congrEquiv_mul. Sorry to be a bother, but is there anything else I should add? (I promise to keep it in mind for future PRs!)
The CI error is likely caused by a change in the script that handles the PR summary.  If you merge current master and push to GitHub, the error should resolve itself.

> The CI error is likely caused by a change in the script that handles the PR summary. If you merge current master and push to GitHub, the error should resolve itself.

aha! thank you so much, I was terribly confused
⚠️ The sha of the head commit of this PR conflicts with #18620. Mergify cannot evaluate rules on this PR. ⚠️

@hannahfechtner It seems that you accidentally force-pushed the code of another branch.

Hopefully you can still find the correct commit in your `git ref-log`.

> @hannahfechtner It seems that you accidentally force-pushed the code of another branch.
> 
> Hopefully you can still find the correct commit in your `git ref-log`.

Yup. I had resigned myself to just re-doing it, but `git reflog` worked perfectly!

One rule of thumb when adding definitions to mathlib is that they should be accompanied by lemmas that provide the basic API.

Typically, such lemmas could be tagged with `@[simp]` if they are simplifying a left-hand side to a right-hand side.

In this case, it would be good to have lemmas about how your definitions interact with generators of the free monoid, etc...

Maybe you can add this theorems and use them in the proof:
```lean
theorem map_invFun_map_toFun_eq {x : FreeMonoid α} : (map e.invFun) (map e.toFun x) = x := sorry
theorem map_toFun_map_invFun_eq {x : FreeMonoid β} : (map e.toFun) (map e.invFun x) = x := sorry
```
good idea, thanks!

We use "iso" for the category-theoretic notion, and "equiv" for rest.
```suggestion
def congrEquiv : FreeMonoid α ≃* FreeMonoid β :=
```
got it, thanks!

```suggestion
def comapRel (rel : FreeMonoid β → FreeMonoid β → Prop) : FreeMonoid α → FreeMonoid α → Prop :=
```
Could you please generalize this to a function `f : \a \to \b` using `FreeMonoid.map`? Because you don't need an equiv between α and β for this definition; a function is enough.
oy, you're totally right. fixed!

```suggestion
@[to_additive (attr := simp)]
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive (attr := simp)]
```

Because `congrEquiv` is a `MulEquiv`, this lemma is in fact a bit superfluous. `(congrEquiv e).map_one` already gives it.

Sorry for the yoyo effect, but could you please drop this one, and the `_mul` lemma?
sure thing!

This is a useful lemma. Just a minor nitpick on the spelling.
```suggestion
theorem congrEquiv_of (e : α ≃ β) (a : α) : congrEquiv e (of a) = of (e a) := rfl
```
Can you please also add `congrEquiv_symm_of`?
done!

```suggestion
theorem map_symm_map_apply_eq {x : FreeMonoid α} (e : α ≃ β) :
```
changed!

```suggestion
theorem map_apply_map_symm_eq {x : FreeMonoid β} (e : α ≃ β) :
```
changed!

For these next two definitions, could you please add `_iff` lemmas that state how they interact with generators?
```suggestion
def mapRel (f : β → α) (rel : FreeMonoid α → FreeMonoid α → Prop) : FreeMonoid β → FreeMonoid β  →
```

I'm sorry, I can't quite figure out what you mean. I don't see how I could apply this to the FreeMonoid generators (it is entirely possible that none of the relations holds between elements of length one - for example, in the braid monoid), and there aren't generators for `f` or `rel`

If you could give me a hint, I'd be happy to add this :)

```suggestion
@[to_additive "given a function from α to β, convert a relation predicate with underlying
```

`mapRel` and `comapRel` are now identical (up to renaming of arguments).
My suspicion is that you will only need `comapRel`. But if you think it is useful, you can restore the version of `mapRel` that takes an equiv as argument.
This is just `rel on (map f)`. Do we need a separate `def` for it?

```suggestion
  MulEquiv.mk' ⟨FreeMonoid.map ⇑e, FreeMonoid.map ⇑e.symm, fun _ => map_symm_apply_map_eq e,
```
Why not use `where toFun := FreeMonoid.map e` etc? I think that it's more readable. Also, `MulEquiv.mk'` is the same as `MulEquiv.mk`.

Free groups call it `FreeGroup.freeGroupCongr`, quotient groups use `QuotientGroup.congr`. Basic types use `MulEquiv.prodCongr` etc. I would stick to one of the existing naming schemes (also, we should unify them some day).

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/FreeMonoid): free monoids over isomorphic types are isomorphic
